tournament: Clan War League - Champions League I

events.details: War matched! Nova Esports vs Tribe Gaming. 24-hour preparation phase begins
Nova sets anti-2 star bases. Strong ring bases for TH16s, compact anti-Queen Charge layouts
Tribe Gaming opts for anti-3 star layouts. Island bases for TH16, spread layouts for lower THs
Both clans scout bases, plan attacks. Nova identifies Tribe's #1 and #2 as vulnerable to Blizzard
Preparation day ends. Attacks can now begin. War runs for 24 hours
BATTLE DAY BEGINS! Nova and Tribe can now attack. 15v15 war, each player gets 2 attacks
Nova's #7 opens war with perfect 3-star on Tribe's #15. Clean funnel, great execution
Tribe's #12 gets 2-star 78% on Nova #10. Invisibility Spell timing off, Loons killed early
Nova #12 3-stars Tribe #12 mirror. Perfect Earthquake placement, Root Riders dominate
Nova clears bottom 5 bases (11-15) with all 3-stars. Tribe gets 3/5 three-stars on their bottom bases
Score after 4 hours: Nova 25 stars, Tribe 20 stars. Nova leading by 5 stars
HUGE! Tribe's Lenaide 3-stars Nova's #2 base (considered one of hardest). Perfect Queen Charge into core, Hybrid cleanup
Nova's iTzu attempts Tribe's #1 but gets only 2-star 87%. Invisibility Spell miscalculation, defensive Eagle Artillery destroys Loons
Score: Nova 37 stars, Tribe 35 stars. War extremely close! Only 2-star difference
Tribe's #5 3-stars Nova mirror. Yeti-Bowler-Witch composition overwhelms base
TURNING POINT! Nova's Judo Sloth dips down to 3-star Tribe's #3. Massive percentage gain. Perfect Log Launcher pathing
Score: Nova 41 stars, Tribe 40 stars. Nova barely holding 1-star lead
Players begin using second attacks for cleanup and percentage hunting
Tribe #8 attempts dip attack on Nova #4 (TH16) but gets only 1-star 62%. Failed to reach TH
Both clans focus on maximizing destruction percentage for tiebreaker scenarios
CLUTCH! Nova's Klaus 3-stars Tribe's #1 on second attack! Perfect Invisibility Spell timing, Loons survive to clean up
Score: Nova 44 stars, Tribe 43 stars. Nova extends lead to 1 star with 4 hours remaining
Tribe's #6 secures 3-star on Nova #8. Clean attack, TH destroyed in 2:15
Both clans use remaining attacks for percentage optimization. Every percent matters for potential tiebreaker
Nova #9 adds another 3-star. Nova pulling ahead in final hour
Final attacks being launched. Tribe needs stars, Nova playing defensive with percentage attacks
Tribe's #4 dips for guaranteed 3-star. Closes gap but not enough
WAR ENDS! Final scores tallied. All attacks used

final_stats.perfect_wars: No (both clans missed 3-stars on some bases)

mvp_nova.performance: 3-star on Tribe #1 (hardest base) on second attempt. Clutch performance

mvp_tribe.performance: 3-star on Nova #2 (very difficult base). Kept Tribe in the war

key_moments.impact: Kept Tribe competitive, showed Nova's top bases were attackable

key_moments.description: Nova's iTzu fails to 3-star Tribe's #1, only gets 2-star 87%
key_moments.impact: Missed opportunity for Nova to pull ahead decisively

key_moments.description: Nova's Judo Sloth dips to 3-star Tribe's #3
key_moments.impact: TURNING POINT - Strategic dip attack gave Nova crucial star advantage

key_moments.description: Nova's Klaus 3-stars Tribe's #1 on second attack
key_moments.impact: Sealed the victory for Nova, eliminated Tribe's toughest base

tactical_notes.nova_strategy: Nova played aggressive with dip attacks (higher TH attacking lower TH) to secure guaranteed 3-stars. Strong on cleanup, maximized destruction percentage. Klaus's second attack on Tribe #1 was war-winning decision.
tactical_notes.tribe_strategy: Tribe focused on mirror hits and percentage battles. Lenaide's heroics kept them close, but lack of dip attacks hurt them. Missed 3-stars on key bases (Nova #2, #4) proved costly.
winning_factors: Nova's willingness to dip attack for guaranteed stars
Better second attack usage for cleanup and tough bases
Klaus's clutch 3-star on Tribe's #1 in final hours
Superior Root Rider Smash execution (100% success)
tribe_mistakes: Too conservative with dip attacks early
Failed to secure Nova's top 2 bases when attempted
Lower average destruction percentage cost tiebreaker potential

effective_bases: Nova #1 (TH16) - Held until Klaus's second attack, anti-Blizzard design
Tribe #1 (TH16) - Held until Klaus clutch attack, strong core
Nova #4 (TH16) - Held against dip attempt, caused 1-star fail
vulnerable_bases: Tribe #3 (TH16) - Vulnerable to Super Witch Smash dip

clan_war_league_context.standings_impact: Critical win for Nova, keeps them in top 3 for promotion/prizes

commentary:
This Champions League I war between Nova Esports and Tribe Gaming was an absolute nail-biter that came down to a single star difference. Both clans are considered among the world's best, and this war showcased why.

The war started evenly, with both clans efficiently clearing their bottom bases. The first major moment came at the 4-hour mark when Nova held a 5-star lead, but Tribe's Lenaide delivered a game-changing 3-star on Nova's #2 base - a base many thought was impossible to triple.

Nova's iTzu responded by attempting Tribe's #1 base but could only manage 2-stars at 87%. This missed 3-star would prove crucial. The war remained incredibly close, with scores tied or within 1-2 stars for most of the battle day.

The true turning point came at 36:45 when Nova's Judo Sloth made the strategic decision to 'dip' - attacking Tribe's #3 base (lower than his #4 position) to secure a guaranteed 3-star with Super Witch Smash. This attack showed Nova's tactical maturity - they were willing to sacrifice 'honor' (mirror hits) for guaranteed stars.

As the war entered its final hours, Nova led by just 1 star. Tribe pushed hard with their remaining attacks, but Nova's Klaus delivered the decisive blow - a perfect Blizzard Lalo 3-star on Tribe's #1 base using his second attack. This was the clutch performance Nova needed.

The final score of 45-44 stars (1 star difference, 27% destruction advantage) showcases how evenly matched these clans are. Nova's superior dip attack strategy and Klaus's heroics secured the win.

Key Lessons:
1. In close wars, strategic dip attacks for guaranteed stars > risking mirror fails
2. Second attacks should target difficult bases, not just cleanup
3. Destruction percentage matters for tiebreakers - every percent counts
4. Root Rider and Super Witch strategies proved most consistent (100% success rates)
5. Mental fortitude in final hours crucial - Klaus's pressure 3-star won the war

This war exemplifies top-tier Clash of Clans competitive play - perfect execution, strategic depth, and clutch performances under pressure.
